entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 3:23PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED WATER LEVELS EXPECTED FOR KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY... There is increasing confidence for a strong frontal system to bring gusty southerly gale force winds to the Kuskokwim Delta coast Thursday into Friday. The resulting higher seas and surf coinciding with high tide could raise water levels 2 to 5 feet
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kuskokwim Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 2:43PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Winds, Rough Surf and Localized High Water... A strong low will bring gusty westerly winds as high as 55 mph beginning tonight and peaking early Wednesday morning. Rough surf and a minor rise in water levels is also expected during this time and may be 1-1.5 feet above the normal high tide line. Winds and water levels will gradually diminish throughout the day.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 2:43PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Water Levels Rising Again Later This Week And Weekend... Multiple weather fronts will bring several rounds of rain to the Brooks Range and portions of the North Slope. The most significant rainfall is expected Thursday night through Saturday with 0.5 to 1.5 inches of rain likely west of the Dalton Highway. Rivers draining the Brooks Range will rise again later this week,
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeastern Brooks Range; Northwestern Brooks Range
